title: 88 postal operators suspend services to US over tariffs: UN
byline: Postal traffic to the United States plunged more than 80 per cent following Washington’s imposition of new tariffs, with 88 operators worldwide fully or partially suspending services, the Universal Postal Union said on Saturday (Sep 6).

title: Rare total lunar eclipse ‘blood moon’ to be visible from Sri Lanka tonight
byline: Sri Lankans will have a rare opportunity to witness the phenomenon known as “blood moon” later today (07), said Prof Chandana Jayaratne, the Head of the Department of Physics and Director, Astronomy and Space Science Unit of the University of Colombo.

title: Binara Poya falls today
byline: The Binara Full Moon Poya Day falls today (07).

title: Showery condition to enhance due to atmospheric disturbance
byline: Atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for evening thundershowers in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva provinces during the next few days.

title: Mark Volman, singer and co-founder of The Turtles, dies at 78
byline: American singer Mark Volman died on Friday (Sep 5) at the age of 78 following a “brief, unexpected illness”, his representative has confirmed.

title: Mineral transportation suspended during two time periods on school days: GSMB
byline: Steps have been taken to suspend mineral transportation activities during school days from 6:30 a.m. to 7:45 a.m. and from 11:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. by the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB).

title: London police arrest 150 at pro-Palestine Action protest
byline: Police made around 150 arrests on Saturday at a protest in central London in support of advocacy network Palestine Action, London’s Metropolitan Police said on social media.

title: Special attention will be given in Budget to modernise the public service: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says special attention will be given in the upcoming Budget to modernising the public service and strengthening local government institutions.

title: Sri Lanka’s remittance inflow exceeds US$ 5 billion in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka has received USD 680.8 million in workers’ remittances in August 2025, according to the latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Popular Sydney beach deploys drones, helicopter after fatal shark attack
byline: Australian authorities on Sunday (Sep 7) deployed drones and a helicopter to monitor the waters around a popular Sydney beach after a surfer was killed by a great white shark on Saturday, officials said.

title: Four dead in separate road accidents
byline: A total of four individuals, including a 22-year-old have died in four separate road accidents reported yesterday (06) across various areas in the country.

title: Mineral transportation suspended during two time slots on school days: GSMB
byline: Steps have been taken to suspend mineral transportation activities during school days from 6:30 a.m. to 7:45 a.m. and from 11:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. by the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB).

title: UK police arrest about 425 at protest for banned Palestine Action
byline: Police made around 150 arrests on Saturday at a protest in central London in support of advocacy network Palestine Action, London’s Metropolitan Police said on social media.

title: Microsoft says Azure cloud service disrupted by fiber cuts in Red Sea
byline: Microsoft said on Saturday that its Microsoft Azure users may experience increased latency due to multiple undersea fiber cuts in the Red Sea.

title: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath departs for Geneva to attend UNHRC session
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, departed for Geneva, Switzerland, this morning (07) at around 6:45 a.m.

title: Strict action against drivers of vehicles with unauthorised modifications from tomorrow
byline: The strict enforcement of the law will begin tomorrow against drivers of vehicles operating with dangerous and unauthorised modifications, Deputy Minister of Transport Dr. Prasanna Gunasena has stated.

title: Another stock of chemicals suspected to be used for ‘Ice’ drug production found in Tangalle
byline: Another stock of chemicals suspected to be used in the production of crystal methamphetamine (ICE) has been discovered this morning (07) on a property in Netolpitiya, Tangalle.

title: Infant among three killed in Russian attack that sets ablaze seat of Ukraine government
byline: An infant was among three people who died in Russia’s overnight attacks on Kyiv that injured 18 and set on fire scores of buildings in the capital, including the seat of the government, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday.

title: Japan Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba decides to step down
byline: Embattled Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will resign to avoid a split within his ruling party, Japanese media reported on Sunday, pitching the world’s fourth-largest economy into fresh political uncertainty.

title: Man hacked to death in Horana
byline: A man has been assaulted and murdered in Kebellegoda, Horana, police stated.
